alert.note: Alert for Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 10:57PM MDT by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...Gusty outflow winds from showers and thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Carbon, northeastern Albany, northwestern Platte and southern Converse Counties through 1145 PM MDT... At 1056 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking showers and thunderstorms producing gusty outflow winds along a line extending from Deer Creek to 7 miles southeast of Little Medicine School to near Battle Mountain. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Douglas, Glenrock, Rolling Hills, Rolling Hills Estates, Battle Mountain, Esterbrook, Friend Park Campground, Curtis Gulch Campground, Laramie Peak, Esterbrook Campground, Laprele Reservoir, Windy Peak, Deer Creek, Garrett, Boxelder, Wheatland Reservoir 3, Campbell Creek Campground, Little Medicine School and Harris Park. This includes Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 124 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Central Laramie Range and Southwest Platte County; Converse County Lower Elevations; East Platte County; Ferris, Seminoe, Shirley Mountains; North Laramie Range; Shirley Basin
